messageBody:
Veena,

I cannot tell where you have your .class file since the javac portion of your
build.xml is not shown. I am assuming from the run-junit target that you have
created it in the same directory as the .java file? If so, the problem is
Junit cannot find your class because it needs to have the basedir in it's
classpath and filenames must reference from the basedir so as to pick up the
package/directory name properly.

Based on the assumption that the .class file is sitting in ${basedir}/test
beside the .java file, the following run-junit target works:

<target name="run-junit" description="junit-run" >
<junit printsummary="true" haltonfailure="false">
<classpath>
<pathelement path="${basedir}" />
</classpath>
<formatter type="brief" usefile="true"/>
<batchtest fork="true" todir="${test}">
<fileset dir="${basedir}"
includes="**/*Test.class"/>
</batchtest>
</junit>
</target>

You might want to consider implementing a directory structure along the lines
of:

basedir
src
testsrc
build
classes
lib
lib

to keep the .class files away from the .java files for ease of cleaning up,
building jars, etc...

Regards,

Lynne
